intro: Cestrum hirtum, commonly known as the hairy cestrum, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, blooming in late summer to early autumn. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, hard seeds. Cestrum hirtum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
